{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3624779,"name":"Braden Haskell","username":"bhaskell09","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-14T22:48:29.290Z","cooked":"

Photon Vision has been crashing my code with the following error:

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>>                                           ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> You are running an incompatible version   ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> of PhotonVision !                         ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>>                                           ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> PhotonLib v2025.3.1 is built for OpenCV 4.10.0 ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> but you are using OpenCV 4.6.0>>>                                           ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> This is neither tested nor supported.     ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> You MUST update PhotonVision,             ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> PhotonLib, or both.                       ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> Verify the output of `./gradlew dependencies`  ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>>                                           ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> Your code will now crash.                 ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> We hope your day gets better.             ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>>                                           ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>> !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ﻿
﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿ >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ﻿

Has anyone had this error/know how to fix it? I’ve already done ./gradlew dependencies, updated PhotonLib and WPILib is the latest version.

PhotonLib is TOO up-to-date. You need to update photonvision on whatever device you’re running it on (raspberry/orange pi, etc)

Ah, something I probably should have mentioned, our robot doesn’t currently have its coprocessors (orange pi’s), but this error is still crashing the code, all we wanted to do was some drive practice.

I’m actually not sure that’s what this is. It’s talking about OpenCV, not the Photon coprocessor. I remember seeing a few teams with this issue earlier this year, but I have no idea what the solution was.

What WPILib version are you on?

I’d also recommend checking to make sure all of your vendor deps are up to date.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-05-14T23:14:27.313Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501751,"topic_slug":"opencv-is-version-4-6-0-and-needs-to-be-4-10-0","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/opencv-is-version-4-6-0-and-needs-to-be-4-10-0/501751/6","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3624860,"name":"Jade","username":"spacey_sooty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/spacey_sooty/{size}/256378_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T01:18:05.233Z","cooked":"

Are you sure WPILib is on the latest version? This crash is normally caused by your WPILib being too old for your photonlib.
If your WPILib is up to date I’d try running ./gradlew clean then retrying.

I’ve also opened Fix opencv version checking error by spacey-sooty · Pull Request #1963 · PhotonVision/photonvision · GitHub to fix the recommended fix for this error. Sorry for the confusion.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-05-15T01:22:43.434Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":75.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":501751,"topic_slug":"opencv-is-version-4-6-0-and-needs-to-be-4-10-0","display_username":"Jade","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/PhotonVision/photonvision/pull/1963","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Fix opencv version checking error by spacey-sooty · Pull Request #1963 · PhotonVision/photonvision · GitHub","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60214,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4788 | Choreo | PhotonVision"},"post_url":"/t/opencv-is-version-4-6-0-and-needs-to-be-4-10-0/501751/7","custom_user_title":"4788 | Choreo | PhotonVision","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3624881,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-15T01:47:10.226Z","cooked":"
spacey_sooty:

Are you sure WPILib is on the latest version? This crash is normally caused by your WPILib being too old for your photonlib.

In particular, WPILib 2023 used OpenCV 4.6.0. So either WPILib is a 2023 version, or you have a 2023 vendordep that is pulling in OpenCV 4.6.0.
